title: Dame Helen Mirren blows kisses to her fans at the Golden Globe Awards 2016
title_page: Dame Helen Mirren blows kisses to her fans at the Golden Globe Awards 2016 | Daily Mail Online
text:
Dame Helen Mirren appeared to be perfectly in her element as she walked the red carpet at the 73rd annual Golden Globe Awards on Sunday night.
The 70-year-old actress blew kisses to the crowds as she as she arrived at the Hilton in Beverly Hills to celebrate the big night.
Working her magic, Helen showed off her incredible figure in a simple black gown by Badgley Mischka which had a plunging sweetheart neckline with a mesh section.
Scroll down for video
That's one way to shine: Dame Helen Mirren appeared to be perfectly in her element as she walked the red carpet at the 73rd annual Golden Globe Awards on Sunday night.
Helen was up for Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role in any Motion Picture for her role in Trumbo, but was beaten by Kate Winslet who starred in the Steve Jobs biopic.
Trumbo tells the story of Dalton Trumbo, who in 1947, was Hollywood's top screenwriter, until he and other artists were jailed and blacklisted for their political beliefs.
But Mirren still shone on the night as she dazzled in diamonds, drawing attention to her decolletage with a statement necklace by Harry Winston as well as a matching bracelet.

Lost out: Helen was up for Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role in any Motion Picture for her role in Trumbo, but was beaten by Kate Winslet who starred in the Steve Jobs biopic
She dazzled in diamonds: Helen drew attention to her decolletage with a statement necklace by Harry Winston as well as a matching bracelet, reported worth more than a million dollars
The jewels were reported to have been worth more than a million dollars.
She carried an embellished silver clutch bag in her hand as she walked down the red carpet.
Posing with her hands confidently on her hip, she wore her blonde locks behind her ear as she added some colour to her look with a slick of berry lipstick.
Double act: Helen Mirren and Gerard Butler took to the stage to present an award at Sunday night's ceremony
Carrying on the fun: Helen attended the Weinstein Company & Netflix Golden Globe afterparty
According to the Washington Post, Matt Lauer told Helen that he had read in an interview that she doesnâ€™t like the word 'sexy.'
Then he looked her up and down and said, 'tough.'
But humble Helen told him the reason she is this glam is because of her team of hair and makeup stylists who put her together then cheer her on as she walks out the door.
During the ceremony, Helen co-presented the Best Motion Picture in a Foreign Language award with Gerard Butler.
The pair thrilled viewers with their flirtatious exchanges, before announcing Hungarian film Son of Saul the winner.
And despite losing out to Kate Winslet in the Best Supporting Actress category, Helen remained in good spirits and headed to the Weinstein Company & Netflix afterparty where she hung out with Morgan Freeman.
Eyes wide shut: The actress cosied up to Morgan Freeman, with the actor making a cheeky facial expression
Stunning: Helen was the picture of elegance as she modeled her jewels for the camera
